items.title: Youth Conservation Ambassador Program
items.description: Join PA's elite conservation training program. Conduct real field research, earn badges, and become a conservation leader. Open to students grades 6-12.

items.title: Spring Trout Stocking Volunteer Day
items.description: Help stock trout in PA streams. Learn from PFBC biologists about fisheries management.

items.title: Monthly Stream Cleanup & Restoration
items.description: Ongoing stream restoration on Deer Creek. Includes invasive species removal, bioengineering, and macro monitoring.

items.org: PA Department of Conservation & Natural Resources
items.title: Environmental Education Internship
items.description: Summer internship assisting with environmental education programs at PA State Parks. College credit available.

items.title: Coldwater Stream Survey - Student Ride-Along
items.description: Shadow PFBC fisheries biologists during brook trout population surveys. Learn electrofishing, data collection, and habitat assessment techniques.

items.title: Citizen Science Saturdays
items.description: Monthly citizen science programs at local libraries. Topics include: water quality monitoring, iNaturalist submissions, macro identification.

items.title: WildPraxis Watershed Field Day
items.description: Use the WildPraxis app for real watershed monitoring. Collect data, identify macros, build habitat scores. Data contributes to statewide conservation database.

items.title: Annual Macro Invertebrate Blitz
items.location: Boyce Park, North Park, South Park
items.description: County-wide stream survey day. Teams collect and identify macros at multiple sites. Results used for county watershed health report.
